headline: Bank of New York Mellon approached Northern Trust to discuss potential merger, WSJ reports
summary: The chief executives of BNY and Northern Trust had at least one conversation, but no offer was discussed, the newspaper reported citing people familiar with the matter.  BNY may approach Northern Trust in the future with a formal bid, however it may not result in a transaction, the report added.  BNY has a market cap of $65.55 billion while Northern Trust has a market cap of $21.76 billion, according to LSEG.

headline: Northern Trust commits to independence after WSJ report on potential merger with BNY
summary: NEW YORK -Northern Trust is fully committed to remaining independent, the bank said on Monday, after the Wall Street Journal reported that Bank of New York Mellon had approached the asset and wealth...
